title: Understanding Async/Await in JavaScript
content: Async/Await is a syntactic sugar built on top of Promises in JavaScript. It allows developers to write asynchronous code that looks and behaves like synchronous code, making it easier to read and maintain. The 'async' keyword is used to declare a function as asynchronous, while the 'await' keyword is used to pause the execution of the function until a Promise is resolved. This helps in handling asynchronous operations more effectively, avoiding callback hell and improving error handling through try/catch blocks.
